sub_topic: Finding the Hamiltonian cycle in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph with vertices A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H:
```
     A
   /   \
  B     C
  |     |
  D-----E
  |     |
  F     G
   \   /
     H
```
Find the hamiltonian cycle in the graph.
message_2:
A Hamiltonian cycle is a closed loop on a graph where every node (vertex) is visited exactly once. In the given graph, one Hamiltonian cycle can be represented as:

A -> B -> D -> F -> H -> G -> E -> C -> A

This cycle visits all vertices exactly once and returns to the starting vertex A, forming a closed loop.
